title: How Armenia is trying to build a Silicon Valley in the Caucasus
snippets: The country is aiming to boost its technology sector by training children in tech from a young age.
titles: How Armenia is trying to build a Silicon Valley in the Caucasus
summary: The country has initiated a program to strengthen its technology sector by introducing tech education for children at an early age. This move is designed to cultivate a skilled workforce in the technology field, addressing future industry demands and enhancing national competitiveness in the global tech arena.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it highlights a solution (tech education for children) that Armenia is implementing to improve its technology sector. It provides readers with actionable insights about the importance of early tech education and its potential impacts on national competitiveness.

title: Will Bangkok fall out of love with skyscrapers after earthquake rocks city?
snippets: Some residents of the world's 12th tallest city fear returning to high-rise living a month on from earthquake.
titles: Will Bangkok fall out of love with skyscrapers after earthquake rocks city?
summary: A month after an earthquake, some inhabitants of the world's 12th tallest city remain apprehensive about returning to high-rise living. The seismic event has evidently left a lasting impact on the confidence and safety perceptions of these residents towards residing in tall buildings.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful context about the impacts of natural disasters on urban living preferences, specifically in the context of Bangkok. However, it doesn't offer any solutions or progress towards addressing the issue, hence the score is not higher.

title: WATCH:  Speedboat goes flying during competition on Arizona's Lake Havasu
snippets: A speedboat flipped and went airborne during a competition Saturday on Lake Havasu in Arizona. The two racers onboard were said to be a little banged up but otherwise OK.
titles: WATCH:  Speedboat goes flying during competition on Arizona's Lake Havasu
summary: During a competition on Lake Havasu, Arizona, on Saturday, a speedboat flipped and became airborne. The two racers inside the boat were reported to have sustained minor injuries but are otherwise in good condition.
constructiveness_reason: This story is largely sensational, focusing on a dramatic event without providing much depth or insight. It does raise basic awareness about the potential dangers of speedboat racing, but it doesn't offer any actionable insights or solutions to improve safety.

title: Demand slump fuelled by Trump tariffs hits US ports and air freight
snippets: Bookings plunge as importers hold off on shipping goods to America in hope of Beijing-Washington deal
titles: Demand slump fuelled by Trump tariffs hits US ports and air freight
summary: Bookings for shipping goods to the United States have significantly decreased as importers are delaying their shipments in anticipation of a potential trade deal between Beijing and Washington. This development indicates a wait-and-see approach among businesses, reflecting their hope for a favorable outcome from the ongoing negotiations between the two countries.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful context about the impacts of trade policies on shipping and freight industries, which could inform business decisions. However, it does not highlight any solutions or improvements, and its focus on a potential future event (a trade deal) may limit its immediate usefulness.
